feed.title: Google Cloud: Anthos clusters on Azure
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Anthos clusters on Azure

entry.content:
You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:

  • 1.34.1-gke.4700
  • 1.33.5-gke.1900
  • 1.32.9-gke.1800
entry.summary: We are pleased to announce the availability of new Kubernetes versions for cluster launches. You can now deploy clusters with updated versions 1.34.1-gke.4700, 1.33.5-gke.1900, and 1.32.9-gke.1800. Please refer to the release notes for detailed information on each patch.
entry.title: Announcement: New Kubernetes Versions Available

entry.content:
The following versions are not recommended:

  • 1.33.4-gke.900
  • 1.32.8-gke.600
  • 1.32.4-gke.200

If you use any of the preceding versions, we strongly recommend that you upgrade to version 1.34 or the latest available patch versions.
entry.summary: Certain versions of our software are no longer recommended. We strongly advise upgrading to version 1.34 or the latest available patch versions to ensure optimal performance and security.
entry.title: Issue: Deprecation Notice for Specific Versions

entry.content:
Multiple security vulnerabilities have been identified in the OpenSSL library. The most significant finding is CVE-2025-15467, a critical vulnerability that might allow for remote code execution (RCE) or denial of service (DoS) attacks via network-based vectors.

For more details, see the GCP-2026-006 security bulletin.
entry.summary: Critical security flaws have been found in the OpenSSL library, including CVE-2025-15467, which could lead to remote code execution or denial of service attacks. Users are advised to review the details and apply necessary updates.
entry.title: Security: OpenSSL Security Vulnerabilities Disclosed

entry.content:
You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:

  • 1.33.4-gke.900
  • 1.32.8-gke.600
  • 1.31.11-gke.400
entry.summary: New Kubernetes versions are now available for cluster launches. See release notes for details on each patch.
entry.title: Announcement: New Kubernetes versions available

entry.content:
The following Kubernetes versions are retired and are no longer available for creating new clusters:

  • 1.31.4-gke.500
  • 1.30.8-gke.100
  • 1.29.12-gke.100

To create a cluster, use another available Kubernetes version.
entry.summary: The following Kubernetes versions are no longer available for new clusters: 1.31.4-gke.500, 1.30.8-gke.100, and 1.29.12-gke.100. Please use an available version when creating new clusters.
entry.title: Issue: Kubernetes versions retired

entry.content:
You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:

  • 1.32.4-gke.200
  • 1.31.7-gke.1000
  • 1.30.11-gke.800
entry.summary: New versions of Kubernetes are available for your clusters, including 1.32.4-gke.200, 1.31.7-gke.1000, and 1.30.11-gke.800. For more details on these releases, please refer to the provided links.
entry.title: Announcement: New Kubernetes versions available

entry.content:
You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:

  • 1.31.6-gke.200
  • 1.30.10-gke.200
  • 1.29.14-gke.200
entry.summary: New cluster versions are available for launch, including 1.31.6-gke.200, 1.30.10-gke.200, and 1.29.14-gke.200. Visit the provided links for detailed release notes on each patch.
entry.title: Announcement: New Cluster Versions Available
